Any help?

items.title: Wrong swagger grouping of root urls
items.body:
Hi,
I'm using the last version of Django, Django REST Swagger and DRF.
My currently api structure is: 

/api/model1/
     /api/model1/delete/
/api/model2/
    /api/model2/create/
/api/model3/
   /api/model3/update/

get_swagger_view returns a single "api" group with all urls inside (flat view).
How can I group my endpoints my model1, model2, model3.... ???

Thank you in advance :)

items.title: Swagger is to slow for many apps
items.body:
# How to set a different swagger for each of my apps in the project?

### I have seen in other issues the same problem, but all the solutions were not efficient, so I though about it, and try to a find a better way to solve that problem. 

### My project contains around 1000 urls for the api, and I need to render all of them.
### In my solution, i though about slicing the swagger by app, ex:
#### When I access the url /docs/app1/ it brings all my application1 urls and only for the application1, so it make the render faster.

items.title: Django Rest framework swagger base url Https
items.body: I have successfully running my rest framework swagger on localhost.. These was my rest framework swagger localhost screenshoot. It has run successfully. Now i want to deploy it on server testing. These is the screenshot result of my testing deployment. As you can see the base path changed and served from localhost, the schemes read the right configuration which is https schemes, and the application run in the right domain which is api.executivemafia.com, so that's not problem. The problem come when I want to try the API. The server point is localhost. So it's make my endpoint request become 'https://127.0.0.1:8000/instagram/hello". My questions are: Why the rest framework swagger still read localhost although my application already served in https://api.executivemafia.com/docs/? Fyi, I set the proxy pass nginx to locahost:8000 because my gunicorn run on localhost:8000. Can the base url rest framework swagger testing server using my testing server domain end point ? If it's able to, how to do it? Any help and reference will be appreciated. I am using django-rest-swagger version 2.2.0 Thank you Guys!! Regards, Meikelwis Wijaya

items.title: Specify the parameter for GET requests in django-rest-swaggerd for rendering serielizer with GenericAPIVIew
items.body:
In the latest version on Django REST Swagger (2.1.0) YAML docs have been deprecated. I want to know how get swagger parameters to show GET response.

```
class BizDay(GenericAPIView):

    """
    get:
    Check whether this day is a business day in a specified timezone
    """

    authentication_classes = (authentication.SessionAuthentication,)
    serializer_class = BizDayReq

    def get(self, request, version):
        serializer = BizDayReq(data=request.query_params)
        serializer.is_valid(True)
        data = serializer.validated_data
        regions = data['regions']
        base_region = regions[0]
        days_offset = data['days_offset']
        cutoff_region = data['cutoff_region']
        cutoff_hour = data['cutoff_hour']

        calendar = TradingCalendar(*regions)

        #Business logic
        #....


        resp = {
            'date': dt_next.strftime('%Y-%m-%d'),
            'tz_region': base_region
        }
        return Response(resp)
```

My serializer

```
class BizDayReq(serializers.Serializer):
    base_date = serializers.IntegerField(required=False)
    regions = serializers.CharField(min_length=2)
    days_offset = serializers.IntegerField(required=False, default=1)
    cutoff_hour = serializers.IntegerField(required=False, default=20)
    cutoff_region = serializers.CharField(required=False, default='HK')

    def validate_regions(self, value):
        return value.split(',')
```

Result of swagger rendering

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40162628/41775646-58193c9a-7657-11e8-8ab1-b48011f77dba.png)

How can I specify the parameters?

items.title: Almost no urls parsed by swagger
items.body:
Hi,
> pip freeze | grep swagger
    django-rest-swagger==2.1.2
I have a DRF API with about 60 EndPoint. django_rest_swagger is only displaying 2, for a reason I don't understand:
TotoView works, NotificationView doesn't
in urls.py:
`# ####################  Test SWAGGER ####################################
    url(r'^dashboard/toto/delete/(?P<pk>[\w\ \,]{0,50})/$', TotoDeleteView.as_view()),
    #########################################################################
    url(r'^dashboard/notification/delete/(?P<pk>[\w\ \,]{0,50})/$', NotificationDeleteView.as_view()),`
in views.py

`
class NotificationDeleteView(generics.DestroyAPIView):
    permission_classes = override_permission_on_dev((permissions.IsAuthenticated,))
    serializer_class = NotificationSerializer
    queryset = Notification.objects.all()

class TotoDeleteView(generics.DestroyAPIView):
    permissions_classes = override_permission_on_dev((permissions.IsAuthenticated,))
    serializer_class = NotificationSerializer
    queryset = Notification.objects.all()
`

It is seriously uncanny! I tried a lot of naming convention etc... found nothing what is going on??


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23218626/38510998-f90c1b38-3c26-11e8-99e2-627f7c11674f.png)

items.title: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'user'
items.body:
When I call `get_object` inside `get_serializer_context` swagger has no `request`. For example

```python
class SomeView(generics.CreateAPIView):

    def get_object(self):
        pk = self.kwargs.get('id')
        
        try:
            return Something.objects.get(
                pk=pk, owner=self.request.user  # Issue
            )
        except Something.DoesNotExist:
            raise exceptions.NotFound(_('Something does not exist.'))

    def get_serializer_context(self):
        context = super(SomeView, self).get_serializer_context()
        context['something'] = self.get_object()
        return context 
```
This works fine, except for swagger docs. Somehow it doesn't have request and it will throw 
```
AttributeError at /
'NoneType' object has no attribute 'user'

Request Method: GET
Request URL: http://localhost:8000/
Django Version: 1.10.1
Python Executable: ..../bin/python
Python Version: 2.7.10
```


If I try to go around this, and use
```python
user = self.request.user if request else None
```
it will display swagger page, but endpoint request (`?format=openapi`) will fail, throwing 'Something does not exist'

The only solution I have so far is using `get_queryset` instead of `get_object` and using `first()` in serializer, which makes more code than I would like.

Using
> djangorestframework==3.5.4
> django-rest-swagger==2.1.1

items.title: Nested URLs not displaying correclty
items.body:
Hello,

I'm trying to document the following endpoints:

_main url conf_
```python
urlpatterns =[
    url(r'^tickers/', include('tickerapi.urls')),
]
```

_and tickerapi/urls:_

```python
schema_view = get_swagger_view(title='Ticker API')

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^docs/', schema_view),
    url(r'^(?P<channel_name>[-\w]+)/', include([
        url(r'^$', views.ChannelUpdateView.as_view(),name='channel_update'), 
        url(r'^ONAIR$', views.CarouselsOnAirContentList.as_view(),name='carousel_onair_content_list'),      
        url(r'^(?P<carousel_name>[-\w]+)$', views.CarouselUpdateView.as_view(), name='carousel_update'),
    ])),
]
```

As you can see, my url are nested in order to have different views handling the following urls:

- /tickers/{channel_name} (Operations: PUT, PATCH)

- /tickers/{channel_name}/ONAIR (Operations: GET)

- /tickers/{channel_name}/{carousel_name} (Operations: GET, PUT, PATCH)

Only a part of the nested urls are displayed, like so: 

![django_swagger_issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14291638/22975371/cda424fc-f386-11e6-9f19-e7480054e2c3.JPG)

From what I can understand _/tickers/{channel_name}_ and _/tickers/{channel_name}/{carousel_name}_ is considered to be the same endpoint. Indeed, if I only allow GET operation on the view handling _/tickers/{channel_name}/{carousel_name}_ (using a ListAPIView), the missing nest URL is showing in Swagger, minus the GET operation: 

![django_swagger_issue_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14291638/22975411/f82a26e0-f386-11e6-8a76-0b59213ca376.JPG)

Thank you

items.title: Using Regex Flags with DRS
items.body:
Hey all,

We've had to make our API fully case insensitive, and we've implemented this using a regex flag, like this:
```
urlpatterns = patterns('',
    url(r'^(?i)widget/', include(apps.widget)),
    url(r'^(?i)widget2/', include('apps.widget2')),
    url(r'^(?i)docs/', include('rest_framework_swagger.urls')),
)
```
Unfortunately this breaks our swagger documentation. The /docs/ endpoint then tries to make a call like `/docs/api-docs/{var}widget`, which doesn't return anything, and so we end up with no documented endpoints. It seems like the issue is caused by some sort of conversion of flags to {var} which doesn't play nice with Django urlpatterns. Is there any way around this? Perhaps using middleware to adjust the url?

items.title: Document how to get 0.3 behaviour
items.body:
I've just taken a stab at migrating from 0.3 to 2.0, and the experience has not been very smooth; to reproduce the old swagger-ui behaviour required a bunch of step-debugging through the new CoreAPI code to determine what was going on.

Worth adding some disclaimers to the migration docs?

* CoreAPI doesn't provide response schemas, which django-rest-swagger 0.3 did. This makes the generated docs less useful. (https://github.com/marcgibbons/django-rest-swagger/issues/583)
* CoreAPI by default doesn't render endpoints which the logged in user doesn't have permissions for. To override this and get the original 0.3 behaviour of displaying all endpoints, you need to subclass the SchemaGenerator thusly:

```
from rest_framework.schemas import SchemaGenerator

class PublicSchemaGenerator(SchemaGenerator):
    def has_view_permissions(self, path, method, view):
        """
        Return `True` if the incoming request has the correct view permissions.
        """
        return True
```

items.title: Bogus Models generated in schema
Make get_swagger_view() AllowAny by default
items.body:
Following version 2.1.0, the schema view permission class used follows the default settings. This can lead to an unusable spec if authentication is required, and if session auth is not used, leading to a frustrating experience for users wanting to get up and running quickly.

Revert back to a Swagger view rather than wrap the DRF get_schema_view.

Note: endpoint specific permissions should be enforced by providing the `request` to the schema generator.

Relates to #589

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jerojasro/.venvs/tpaga-api/lib/python3.5/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 39, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
  File "/home/jerojasro/.venvs/tpaga-api/lib/python3.5/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 216, in _get_response
    response = self.process_exception_by_middleware(e, request)
  File "/home/jerojasro/.venvs/tpaga-api/lib/python3.5/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 214, in _get_response
    response = response.render()
  File "/home/jerojasro/.venvs/tpaga-api/lib/python3.5/site-packages/django/template/response.py", line 109, in render
    self.content = self.rendered_content
  File "/home/jerojasro/.venvs/tpaga-api/lib/python3.5/site-packages/rest_framework/response.py", line 72, in rendered_content
    ret = renderer.render(self.data, accepted_media_type, context)
  File "/home/jerojasro/.venvs/tpaga-api/lib/python3.5/site-packages/rest_framework_swagger/renderers.py", line 21, in render
    data = self.get_openapi_specification(data)
  File "/home/jerojasro/.venvs/tpaga-api/lib/python3.5/site-packages/rest_framework_swagger/renderers.py", line 34, in get_openapi_specification
    type(data)
AssertionError: Expected a coreapi.Document, but received <class 'NoneType'> instead.
```

The `get_openapi_specification` function should (maybe) be prepared to handle a `None` as its `data` argument.

Or maybe django-rest-framework should be fixed to return an empty `Document` in this situation, instead of `None`, but I'm not sure which one would be the semantically correct solution.

For what is worth, changing django-rest-framework to give back an empty `Document` does not break its tests (see https://github.com/jerojasro/django-rest-framework/commit/0f6edde2acf97f1ecc4411994563a28e4b162598 ), and fixes this issue.

    queryset = Prospect.objects.all()
    renderer_classes = (SwaggerUIRenderer, OpenAPIRenderer)

items.title: How to use the new version (2+) with TokenAuthentication?
items.body:
As far as I understand, the way to include the TokenAuthentication is use the SECURITY_DEFINITIONS settings.

In the [OpenAPI Docs](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/2.0.md#security-definitions-object), in the "api_key" type, there are 3 keys: "type", "name", "in".

I guess that "in" should be "header", name "Authorization" and type should be left "apiKey". Where should I put the value "Token MYTOKEN"?

This ticket may be related to #497 , but I'm not sure.

Thanks in advance

relative paths which might be pointing to the wrong location.
```

Looking in the [images directory](https://github.com/marcgibbons/django-rest-swagger/tree/master/rest_framework_swagger/static/rest_framework_swagger/images), it doesn't appear that `logo.png` (referenced on [line 5 of style.css](https://github.com/marcgibbons/django-rest-swagger/blob/master/rest_framework_swagger/static/rest_framework_swagger/css/style.css#L5)) or `shield.png` (referenced on [line 67 of style.css](https://github.com/marcgibbons/django-rest-swagger/blob/master/rest_framework_swagger/static/rest_framework_swagger/css/style.css#L67)) exist. I removed these two lines and `python manage.py collectstatic` finished without an error.

I replicated the issue on another project that uses version 2.0.1 of django-rest-swagger and had the same error.

items.body:
- Current versions installed in my app:

django-rest-swagger==2.0.1
djangorestframework==3.4.0
- Brief configuration:

-_\- urls.py -_-

router = DefaultRouter()

```

-_\- development server petitions log -_-
[19/Jul/2016 09:36:00] "GET /documentacion/?format=openapi HTTP/1.1" 500 83970

Now if I launch my project and type http://ip:port/documentacion/ in my browser I get an HTTP error 500 and display raw HTML content inside my Swagger view. The problem disappears when I use a logged in user. Anyway when l use a logged in user I still can see and endpoint with the same name that my scheme creator function 'esquema_doc_api' and returns HTML when I fire the GET method on it. I'm not pretty sure if it's supposed to be the standard behaviour.

I'll attach some screenshot with the problem.

Regards,

Javier Civantos

```

The `LogoutView` on the `django-rest-auth` module is a normal APIView:

```
class LogoutView(APIView):

    """
    Calls Django logout method and delete the Token object
    assigned to the current User object.

    Accepts/Returns nothing.
    """
    permission_classes = (AllowAny,)

    def post(self, request):
        try:
            request.user.auth_token.delete()
        except (AttributeError, ObjectDoesNotExist):
            pass

        logout(request)

        return Response({"success": _("Successfully logged out.")},
                        status=status.HTTP_200_OK)


```
